More addicting than crack! Despite being aged as a game engine, this games mechanic's never seem to get old.

Very few games are consistently difficult to beat as a team despite hundreds of hours of practice. Killing Floor will show you that Zombies are out to kill you, and you better make sure every shot counts.

The finest multiplayer game on Steam bar none. Based on 'Killing Floor', a British mod for Unreal Tournament 2004 that influenced Valve's Left 4 Dead, this is the definitive co-op survival game. Very few games managed to replicate the experience of firing a gun with such authenticity. Killing Floor features up to 6 players per match as well as a large number of diverse weapons, enemy types, characters, perks and maps. It is one of the most played games on Steam and for a good reason.
the best first person horror shooter in the world

Great zombie FPS action. Nothing makes a group work together better then the threat of being torn into small bloody parts by a horde of zombies. The christmas patch was also a great example of some of the awesome additions they add to thise game. Recommended to any zombie/fps fan. Enjoy!

I recommend this game to anyone who enjoys survival horror games that are actually a challenge. Love the multiplayer, love the perks, and I love the new character packs that are often added to the game. For such a cheap price too! Deff a must have.

This game is great for horror shooter fans that like co-op over a versus type mode. They have different classes that excel a certain type of player's abilities. Sharpshooter class play to the ones that believe every bullet should be a headshot. Beserker class are the ones that like it up close and personal.....with a melee weapon. And Firebugs like to, well, play with fire. They have a few other classes as well like the classic Medic class or Assault class which focuses on assault rifles. They add in very cheap "4 Character Packs" that allow a more variety characters to be seen. The enemies are essentially failed clones that went beserk in Great Britain, and each map has a little nifty history as to what happened to it. All in all, a great horror co-op shooter with excellent controls.

One part "House of the Dead" horror, two parts "Left 4 Dead" co-op, and add in an economics system similar to "Counter Strike", a near constant wave system simlar to "Serious Sam" and you've got the core of this game.

definately worth buying. dont bother with the character packs, they dont do anything for you unless you have a dollar or two you dont mind spending. but as for the game, it can be slow in the first wave, but once things start warming up, its a fun time killing zed's and staying alive.

Killing Floor is one of those titles that, when it was 'new', I overlooked because of the price tag not fitting my budget and because I was hopped up on TF2. After purchasing it on sale, however, and getting a taste of the action I have to say its a 'bloody good time.' The gameplay is simple; survive waves of increasingly numerous and difficult enemies. Despite this simple style of play the game shows some real personality; various character models, a perk system, a decent arsenal, horrific beings to mow through, and some kick ass level design all tie together to make this a great buy. Most of my friends already have this; why don't you?
Killing Floor is quite a fun game. Plenty of enemies, good difficulty, good need of allies (because ya know, you couldn't really take out whole armies of mutants alone), and all around fun.
Definitiv ein kauf Wert! Macht einen riesen Spass zu 2 oder in einer Gruppe. Extrem viele Maps (Downloadbar) und Wellen von Zombiehorden macht es zu einer lustigen Zeitvertreibung :)

A fun co-op horde shooter which does a good job not to take itself too seriously. It's a different type of game than L4D series and that is a good thing about Killing Floor, it gives players a nice opportunity to escape from the gray-ish tone of L4D world. 

The heavy-metal BGMs keep up with the exciting battles (less depressing musics = more fun). I don't understand people who said this game is ugly while it's actually pretty good looking game, especially nice player models and nice use of lighting effects. 

Gameplay is fun, the in-game shopping is good and it's not easy which means 'good'. In my opinion it's as 'repetitive' as any other online horde games (L4D, Zombie mode in CoD). I would say I enjoy Killing Floor a lot and am willing to come back to its world more often than those of the L4D series.
DOSH!

Un gran juego de supervivencia por oleadas contra decenas de mutantes o lo que dios quiera que sean.
Recomendable para quedar con amigos (siempre que sepan lo que hacen) y divertirse un buen rato a la vez que la dificultad y el número de Zombies va aumentando a medida que pasan las oleadas hasta enfrentarse contra el Patriarch.
Tiene una gran lista de mapas, eventos tanto de Navidad como de Halloween, logros, Player Models para comprar, y mucha arma P2P donde dejarte la pasta si te apetece.
Tampoco hay que olvidar que tiene una gran comunidad e incluso servers modeados ¿A qué esperas para unirte y reventar cabezas a base de escopetazos?

Aviso: Este juego puede crear una gran obsesión por tirar pasta al suelo y mendigar.

Puntuación personal del juego: 8,5 ★★★★

It's like another zombie survival game. However these "zombies" are mutants and they have weapons! Everything is slower than in other games but it's easy to get used to it. It also helps to get headshots (which are necessary on higher difficulties). And there is also a shop, which sell lots of guns. Before I was complaining about the lack of guns and now I can complain about too many DLCs.

this game is really worth getting. if you like co-op and survival horror. this game is a must. the dlc packs for maps are always free !. but the extra char packs are not. ( not worth getting either :P ) but after playing this for so many hours i lost track of time when im shooting clots and bloats and dogding sirens. while im burning / cutting / shooting / blowing every monster that come across my path. this game is a must get for any FPS fanatic out there !
This was the online Co-op zombie experience before Left 4 Dead ever came out. But it also has slow motion, vehicles and zombie Santa Claus. Can you get any better than that?

Great fast paced multiplayer Zombie-like action, first person shooter style. Tons of maps. This game is often on sale, but even buying it at it's full price of 20$ it is worth it for anyone who enjoys Zombies, Guns, and some RPG elements.

This game allows you to have a profile and level up your skill with different weapon types, gaining damage, resistance, free gear, discounts on weapons in game, etc. Not at all story driven, just try to survive wave after wave of a relentless infected speciemen horde, culminating in a final boss fight.
Best $20 I've ever spent.
